BindLinearAssemblyCDNDomainWithChannel.document: Linear Assembly channel is bound to CDN playback domain name.

BindNewLVBDomainWithChannel.document: This API is used to bind an LVB domain name to a channel.

CreateStreamPackageChannel.document: This API is used to create a StreamPackage channel.

CreateStreamPackageChannelEndpoint.document: This API is used to create an endpoint on a StreamPackage channel.
CreateStreamPackageChannelEndpoint.name: Creates a channel endpoint

DeleteStreamPackageChannelEndpoints.document: This API is used to delete endpoints from a StreamPackage channel in batches.
DeleteStreamPackageChannelEndpoints.name: Deletes channel endpoints in batches

DeleteStreamPackageChannels.document: This API is used to delete StreamPackage channels in batches.
DeleteStreamPackageChannels.name: Deletes channels in batches

DeleteStreamPackageLinearAssemblyChannel.document: Delete channels in batches and linearly assemble channels.

DeleteStreamPackageLinearAssemblyProgram.document: Batch deletion of channels linear assembly program.

members.document:
List of timeout parameter configuration
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Info

members.document:
Timeout period (ms), which must be an integer multiple of 1000
.m3u8/.mpd: [1000, 60000]
.ts/.m4s/.mp4: [10000, 1800000]
members.name: Timeout

members.document:
File extension. Valid values: .m3u8, .ts, .mpd, .m4s, .mp4
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Ext

ChannelAlertResp.document: Linear assembly channel alarm return information.

members.document:
Cache configuration
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: CacheInfo

members.document: The vod type is valid, the content is valid starting time, Entire and SpecifyTimeRange are optional.
members.name: Type

members.document: Offset, valid when Type is SpecifyTimeRange.
members.name: Offset

members.document: Endpoint name, which must contain 1 to 32 characters and supports digits, letters, and underscores
members.name: Name

members.document: Endpoint protocol type, supports HLS, DASH, CMAF (only HLS type input can create CMAF Endpoint).
members.name: Protocol

members.document: Whether to turn on the TimeShift function, true: on, false: off, the default is off.
members.name: TimeShiftEnable

members.document: The number of days to look back in TimeShift, up to 30 days is supported.
members.name: TimeShiftDuration

members.document: Information of the created channel endpoint
members.name: Info

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Channel protocol. Valid values: HLS, DASH, CMAF.
members.name: Protocol

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: HarvestJob ID, a globally unique identifier.
members.name: ID

members.document: Time format, supports the following types: 1. Epoch seconds 2. ISO-8601
members.name: TimeFormat

members.document: Task start time supports two formats for TimeFormat input: 1. Epoch seconds: The input box is a numeric input box, and only positive integers can be entered. 2. ISO-8601: The supported format is ISO time, for example: 2023-08-01T10:00:00+08:00.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: Task end time supports two formats for TimeFormat input: 1. Epoch seconds: The input box is a numeric input box, and only positive integers can be entered. 2. ISO-8601: The supported format is ISO time, for example: 2023-08-01T10:00:00+08:00.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: The path where the recording file is stored in Cos.
members.name: Destination

members.document: The file name of the recording file stored in Cos.
members.name: Manifest

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Define the characteristics of the channel. Standard supports live broadcast and on-demand sources. Basic only supports on-demand source arrangement. Optional values: Standard and Basic.
members.name: Tier

members.document:
The source switching modes in the channel are divided into Linear and Loop. Basic only supports Linear, and Standatd supports both.
Optional values: Linear, Standatd.
members.name: PlaybackMode

members.document: Time shift enable switch, only valid when Tier is Standard.
members.name: TimeShiftEnable

members.document: Time shift configuration, effective when the time shift switch is turned on.
members.name: TimeShiftConf

members.document: Spacer configuration is only valid when PlaybackMode is Linear.
members.name: SlateConf

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
The type of arrangement target source is divided into live broadcast and on-demand VOD.
Optional values: Live, VOD.
members.name: SourceType

members.document: The associated live broadcast or on-demand broadcast, source name, and location are globally unique.
members.name: SourceName

members.document: AdBreaks is only valid when the source type is Vod.
members.name: AdBreaks

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Ad insertion configuration name, globally unique, cannot be repeated with other configurations
members.name: Name

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Whether to enable package distribution sharding, it is enabled by default.
members.name: SegmentDeliverUsePackageEnable

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The location id to which this source belongs is required and uniquely bound to one location.
members.name: AttachedLocation

members.document: Source name, globally unique under location.
members.name: Name

members.document: Distinguish between live broadcast and on-demand VOD source types. Optional values: Live, VOD.
members.name: Type

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: DRM system providers, when the encryption method is CBCS, the optional values are `PlayReady`, `Widevine`, `FairPlay`; when the encryption method is CENC, the oprional values are `PlayReady`, `Widevine`.
members.name: DRMSystems

members.document: The resource ID sent to the key server. It can contain 1 to 128 characters, including numbers, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).
members.name: ResourceID

members.document: Key server address; must start with https://.
members.name: KeyServerUrl

members.document:
Video encryption presets, options: 
`Preset Video 1` - Encrypts all video tracks with one key
`Preset Video 2` - Encrypts SD and HD video tracks with 2 different keys
`Preset Video 3` - Encrypts SD, HD and UHD video tracks with 3 different keys
`Preset Video 4` - Encrypts SD, HD, UHD1 and UHD2 video tracks with 4 different keys
`Preset Video 5` - Encrypts SD, HD1, HD2, UHD1 and UHD2 video tracks with 5 different keys
`Preset Video 6` - Encrypts SD, HD1, HD2, UHD video tracks with 4 different keys
`Preset Video 7` - Encrypts SD + HD1, HD2, UHD video tracks with 3 different keys
`Preset Video 8` - Encrypts SD + HD1, HD2, UHD1, UHD2 video tracks with 4 different keys
`Shared` - Encrypts all video and audio tracks with one key
`Unencrypted` - Does not encrypt any track
members.name: VideoEncryptionPreset

members.document:
Audio encryption presets, options:
`Preset Audio 1` - Encrypts all audio tracks with one key
`Preset Audio 2` - Encrypts STEREO and MULTICHANNEL audio tracks with 2 different keys
`Preset Audio 3` - Encrypts STEREO, MULTICHANNEL 3-6 and MULTICHANNEL 7 audio tracks with 3 different keys
`Shared` - Encrypts all video and audio tracks with one key
`Unencrypted` - Does not encrypt any track
members.name: AudioEncryptionPreset

members.document: Optional, used together with the key to encrypt the content; a 128-bit, 32-character, hexadecimal-encoded string.
members.name: ConstantInitializationVector

members.document: Optional, specifies the rotation interval in seconds; empty, or an integer between 300-2592000.
members.name: KeyRotationInterval

DashManifestInfo.document: The manifest info used when Type is DASH.

members.document: The total duration of each manifest in seconds. [30, 3600], type: integer, default value 60.
members.name: Windows

members.document: The minimum cache time (in seconds) that the player keeps in the buffer. [2, 60], type: integer, default value 30.
members.name: MinBufferTime

members.document: The minimum time (in seconds) that the player should wait before requesting an update to the manifest. [2, 60], type: integer, default value 2.
members.name: MinUpdatePeriod

members.document: The time from the latest live broadcast time point when the player starts broadcasting is a rollback amount (in seconds). [2, 60], type: integer, default value 10.
members.name: SuggestedPresentationDelay

EndpointAuthInfo.document: The authentication information of channel endpoints.

members.document:
The security group allowlist in CIDR format.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: WhiteIpList

members.document:
The security group blocklist in CIDR format.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BlackIpList

members.document:
The authentication key. Its value is same as `X-TENCENT-PACKAGE` set in the HTTP request header.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AuthKey

members.document: Whether to turn on the time shift function, true: on, false: off, the default is off.
members.name: TimeShiftEnable

members.document: The number of days in the time shift window, up to 30 days. Valid when TimeShiftEnable is turned on.
members.name: TimeShiftDuration

members.document: The customer-defined url parameter is inserted into the subscript at the specified position of the Endpoint url. The optional range of the subscript is: [0,3].
members.name: CustomUrlParamIndex

members.document:
Customer-defined url parameters are inserted into the specified position of the Endpoint url based on the CustomUrlParamIndex.
The parameters can only contain digits, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-), with a length of 1 to 64 chars.
members.name: CustomUrlParam

members.document: DRM switch. If it is turned on, only CMAF will take effect.
members.name: DRMEnabled

members.document: HarvestJob ID, a globally unique identifier.
members.name: ID

members.name: TimeFormat

members.document: The path where the recording file is stored in COS.
members.name: Destination

members.document: The file name of the recording file stored in COS.
members.name: Manifest

members.document: The task status is divided into running: Running, execution completed: Completed, and execution failure: Failed.
members.name: Status

members.document: HarvestJob creation time, timestamp in seconds.
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: The region corresponding to the harvest job.
members.name: Region

members.document:
Username.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Username

members.document:
Password.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Password

members.document:
Channel input URL.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Url

members.document: Define the characteristics of the channel. Standard supports live broadcast and on-demand sources, while Basic only supports on-demand source arrangement.
members.name: Tier

members.document: The source switching mode in the channel is divided into Linear and Loop. Live broadcast only supports Linear.
members.name: PlaybackMode

members.document: Time shift configuration, vod is valid.
members.name: TimeShiftConf

members.document: List of programs bound to this channel.
members.name: AttachedPrograms

members.document: Channel creation time, unix seconds timestamp.
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: The type of the arrangement target source, divided into live broadcast and on-demand.
members.name: SourceType

members.document: The associated live broadcast or on-demand broadcast, source name, and location are globally unique.
members.name: SourceName

LocationAlert.document: Channel Linear Assembly Location Alarm Information.

members.document: Enter the format of the output advertising tag. Optional values are: Date Range and Enhanced SCTE-35.
members.name: AdMarkupType

members.document: Whether to turn on the time shift function, true: on, false: off, the default is off.
members.name: TimeShiftEnable

members.document: The number of days in the time shift window, up to 30 days. Valid when TimeShiftEnable is turned on.
members.name: TimeShiftDuration

members.document: Ad insertion function configuration information. Valid when SSAIEnable is turned on.
members.name: SSAIInfo

members.document:
The customer-defined url parameter is inserted into the subscript at the specified position of the Endpoint url. 
Calculation starts from the first '/' in the url path, and the subscript starts from 0, the optional range of the subscript is: [0,3].
members.name: CustomUrlParamIndex

members.document:
Customer-defined url parameters are inserted into the specified position of the Endpoint url based on the CustomUrlParamIndex.
The parameters can only contain digits, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-), with a length of 1 to 64 chars.
members.name: CustomUrlParam

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Authentication configuration. Valid values: `CLOSE`, `UPDATE`
`CLOSE`: disable authentication
`UPDATE`: update authentication information
members.name: ActionType

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: New channel protocol. Valid values: HLS, DASH, CMAF.
members.name: Protocol

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Define the characteristics of the channel. Standard supports live broadcast and on-demand sources, while Basic only supports on-demand source arrangement.
members.name: Tier

members.document:
The source switching mode in the channel is divided into Linear and Loop. Live broadcast only supports Linear.
Optional values: Linear, Loop.
members.name: PlaybackMode

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The type of the arrangement target source, divided into live broadcast and on-demand.
members.name: SourceType

members.document: The associated live broadcast or on-demand broadcast, source name, and location are globally unique.
members.name: SourceName

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Ad insertion configuration name, globally unique, cannot be repeated.
members.name: Name

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Whether to enable package distribution sharding, it is enabled by default.
members.name: SegmentDeliverUsePackageEnable

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Distinguish between live broadcast and on-demand VOD source types.
Optional values: Live, VOD (on demand)
members.name: Type

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The output group name can be associated with the source group name.
members.name: GroupName

members.document: The file name output by the channel program after scheduling.
members.name: ManifestName

members.document: The manifest info, used when Type is HLS.
members.name: ManifestConf

members.document: The manifest info, used when Type is DASH.
members.name: DashManifestConf

members.document: The output group name can be associated with the source group name.
members.name: GroupName

members.document: The file name output by the channel program after scheduling.
members.name: ManifestName

members.document: The manifest info, used when Type is HLS.
members.name: ManifestConf

members.document: The manifest info, used when Type is DASH.
members.name: DashManifestConf

members.document: Program duration, in milliseconds, valid for live broadcast.
members.name: Duration

members.document: Program startup method, live broadcast only supports Absolute, on-demand also supports Relative.
members.name: TransitionType

members.document: Unix timestamp, the start execution time of the program in the Absolute scenario.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: It is related to the insertion order of the selected program, divided into After and Before.
members.name: RelativePosition

members.document: The selected insertion reference program id.
members.name: RelativeProgramId

members.document:
Program startup method, live broadcast only supports Absolute, on-demand also supports Relative.
Optional values: Absolute, Relative.
members.name: TransitionType

members.document: Unix timestamp, the start execution time of the program in absolute scenarios.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: Program duration, in milliseconds, valid for live broadcast.
members.name: Duration

members.document: It is related to the insertion order of the selected program, divided into After and Before.
members.name: RelativePosition

members.document: The selected insertion reference program id.
members.name: RelativeProgramId

members.document:
Channel output list.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Endpoints

ProgramAlertCounts.document: Channel Linear Assembly Program Aggregation Alarm Information

ProgramAlertInfos.document: Channel linear assembly program alarm information details.

ProgramScheduleInfo.document: The scheduling information of the Program under this channel.

members.document: The id of the source location.
members.name: SourceLocationId

members.document: SSAI configuration ID, globally unique identifier
members.name: ID

members.document: Whether to enable transparent transmission of advertising tags.
members.name: AdMarkerPassthrough

members.document:
How to process tags in advertisements, optional values: [1,2] 
1: Process all SCTE-35 type tags - all (default) 
2: SCTE-35enhanced, parse some types.
members.name: SCTE35AdType

members.document: Whether to enable mpd location, true corresponds to enable, false corresponds to disable.
members.name: DashMPDLocation

members.document:
The type of tag that is regarded as an advertisement, optional values: [1,8]
1. Splice insert 
2. Provider advertisement 
3. Distributor advertisement 
4. Provider placement opportunity 
5. Distributor placement opportunity 
6. Break 
7. Provider overlay placement opportunity 
8. Distributor overlay placement opportunity.
members.name: AdTriggers

members.document:
The type of distribution restriction that is considered an advertisement, optional values: [1,4]
1:None 
2:Restricted (default) 
3:Unrestricted 
4.Both.
members.name: DeliveryRestrictions

members.document: Source CDN prefix, needs to start with http:// or https://
members.name: SourceCDNPrefix

members.document: Advertising CDN prefix needs to start with http:// or https://
members.name: AdCDNPrefix

SlateInfo.document: Channel linear assembly channel spacer configuration.

members.document: The ID of the source location.
members.name: SourceLocationId

members.document: The corresponding vod shim content source name.
members.name: VodSourceName

SourceAlert.document: Channel Linear Assembly Location Alarm Information

members.document: The source type distinguishes between live broadcast and on-demand Vod.
members.name: Type

members.document: List of bound live broadcast source ids.
members.name: AttachedLiveSources

members.document: List of bound on-demand source ids.
members.name: AttachedVodSources

members.document: Source location creation time, Unix timestamp.
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: Source location last modified time, Unix timestamp.
members.name: UpdateTime

members.document: Whether to enable package distribution sharding, it is enabled by default.
members.name: SegmentDeliverUsePackageEnable

members.document: Group name. When the channel is in Linear mode and vod source is selected, the group name corresponds to the output group name of the channel output.
members.name: GroupName

members.document: Type, distinguish between HLS and DASH, optional values: HLS, DASH.
members.name: Type
